Author: skeet_yeet_repeat
Text: (Warning: Not a doctor, take all this with a hefty grain of salt)  Fat itself affects hormone balances, a rapid drop or a rapid gain in body fat percentage can throw things out of whack. Fat in particular tends to increase estrogen, so a drop in fat could mean an imbalance that tends towards (proportionally) higher  testosterone temporarily.   I know when I went from overweight to normal I suddenly had a lil happy trail of darker than normal fuzz from my navel to my nethers. It faded after being consistently around that weight though.

Author: theworldismadeofcorn
Text: Even if your BMI is "normal" or "healthy" (or even higher than that) your body may still struggle to keep you warm enough if you don't eat enough food or purge the calories you consume.
